official-title.#text: To require the Securities and Exchange Commission to make certain improvements to form 10-K and regulation S-K, and for other purposes.

attestation-date.#text: Passed the House of Representatives December 2, 2014.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Disclosure Modernization and Simplification Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Disclosure Modernization and Simplification Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue regulations to permit issuers to submit a summary page on form 10-K (17 CFR 249.310), but only if each item on such summary page includes a cross-reference (by electronic link or otherwise) to the material contained in form 10-K to which such item relates.

text.#text: Not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take all such actions to revise regulation S-K (17 CFR 229.10 et seq.)—

text.#text: Not later than the end of the 180-day period beginning on the date of the enactment of this Act, the

to further scale or eliminate requirements of regulation S-K, in order to reduce the burden on emerging growth companies, accelerated filers, smaller reporting companies, and other smaller issuers, while still providing all material information to investors;
to eliminate provisions of regulation S-K, required for all issuers, that are duplicative, overlapping, outdated, or unnecessary; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: determines that no further study under section 4 is necessary to determine the efficacy of such revisions to regulation S-K.

header.#text: Study on modernization and simplification of regulation S-K

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall carry out a study of the requirements contained in regulation S-K (17 CFR 229.10 et seq.). Such study shall—

text.#text: determine how best to modernize and simplify such requirements in a manner that reduces the costs and burdens on issuers while still providing all material information;

emphasize a company by company approach that allows relevant and material information to be disseminated to investors without boilerplate language or static requirements while preserving completeness and comparability of information across registrants; and
evaluate methods of information delivery and presentation and explore methods for discouraging repetition and the disclosure of immaterial information.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: and the Advisory Committee on Small and Emerging Companies.

text.#text: In conducting the study required under subsection (a), the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue a report to the

text.#text: Not later than the end of the 360-day period beginning on the date of enactment of this Act, the
all findings and determinations made in carrying out the study required under subsection (a);

specific and detailed recommendations on modernizing and simplifying the requirements in regulation S-K in a manner that reduces the costs and burdens on companies while still providing all material information; and
specific and detailed recommendations on ways to improve the readability and navigability of disclosure documents and to discourage repetition and the disclosure of immaterial information.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall issue a proposed rule to implement the recommendations of the report issued under subsection (c).

text.#text: Not later than the end of the 360-day period beginning on the date that the report is issued to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: under section 3 shall not be construed as satisfying the rulemaking requirements under this section.

text.#text: Revisions made to regulation S-K by the
